content: mug cozy & coaster crochet pattern # us terms for english advanced beginner skill level designed by vonskraftcorner this pattern is designed for a standard-sized coffee mug which measures approximately 10 to 11 inches in circumference and stands between 3 75 and 4 inches tall to determine the appropriate length for your desired mug create a chain and wrap it around the mug to check if you need to add or reduce chains remember to leave enough space for the handle the quantity of chains you use will not impact the final result of this pattern ## abbreviations **chain** - chain **slip_stitch** - slip_stitch **single_crochet** - single_crochet **half_double_crochet** - half_double_crochet **st s ** - stitch ## materials required size h 5mm crochet hook tapestry needle for weaving in ends size 4 worsted weight yarn either acrylic or cotton one color for trim and main color scissors please be aware that this pattern recommends altering the color at both the top and bottom of your cozy however if you d rather not switch colors feel free to stick with the main color and disregard those instructions please read through the entire pattern before beginning your project if you have any questions feel free to reach out to me on etsy thank you # instructions for row 1 begin with the trim color slipknot onto the hook chain 38 start in the second chain from the hook do not include the loop on your hook work 37 single_crochet to finish off fasten_off and tie on the main color through the last stitch you completed you only need to tie it once and pull it tight if you have a preferred method for changing colors feel free to use that however this is my favorite technique tip while crocheting incorporate any loose tails into your stitches to minimize the amount you need to weave in once your project is complete # instructions for row 2 chain 1 work 1 half_double_crochet into the same st continue to work 1 half_double_crochet into each st down the row # instructions for row 3-8 *chain 1 does not count as a st turn work continue to work 1 half_double_crochet into each st across the row 37 repeat from the * a total of 5 more times after finishing the row secure your work and then attach the trim color at the last completed stitch # instructions for row 9 and final touches after attaching the trim color chain 1 then work 1 single_crochet into the same st continue by working 1 single_crochet into each st down the row this will be the top edge of your cozy ## loops at the conclusion of row 9 chain 13 and then *attach it to the opposite end with a sl st to create your first loop for the mug handle fasten_off and weave in the loose ends attach the trim color on the other end of the cozy then chain 13 repeat from * to finish the project sweater
